availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Crittenden County, Kentucky, farmer. South Carolina native. Married to Rebecca Towery. Father of Edward Towery, George H. Towery, Ben F. Towery, Sibby Towery, Malinda Towery, and Aaron Towery. Farmer in Crittenden County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned two enslaved persons in Crittenden County in 1850. Farmer in Crittenden County in 1860. Owned six enslaved persons in Crittenden County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Crittenden County, District 2, p. 271B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Crittenden County, District 2, p. 363.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Crittenden County, District 1, p. 459.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Crittenden County, District 1, p. 355B.
Kentucky, Wills and Probate Records, 1774-1989, Kentucky County, District, and Probate Courts, Crittenden County Administrators Bonds, 1843-1878, p. 387.
